intro: Pinus heldreichii, commonly known as the Hellenic pine, is a species of conifer native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is characterized by its slender, pyramidal shape and needle-like leaves that are typically 5 to 8 centimeters long. The cones of this species are woody and can reach lengths of up to 12 centimeters, containing edible seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. This evergreen tree is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
